com.thomsonreuters.upa.transport

Interface AcceptOptions


  • public interface AcceptOptions
    UPA Accept Options used in the Server.accept(AcceptOptions, Error) call.
    See Also:
    Server

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean channelReadLocking()
      If true, the connection uses lock on read.
      void channelReadLocking(boolean locking)
      If true, the connection will use lock on reading.
      boolean channelWriteLocking()
      If true, the connection uses lock on write.
      void channelWriteLocking(boolean locking)
      If true, the connection will use lock on writing.
      void clear()
      Clears UPA Accept Options.
      boolean nakMount()
      If true, indicates that the server wants to reject the incoming connection.
      void nakMount(boolean nakMount)
      If true, indicates that the server wants to reject the incoming connection.
      int sysSendBufSize()
      The size (in kilobytes) of the system's send buffer used for this connection, where applicable.
      void sysSendBufSize(int sysSendBufSize)
      The size (in kilobytes) of the system's send buffer used for this connection, where applicable.
      java.lang.Object userSpecObject()
      A user specified object.
      void userSpecObject(java.lang.Object userSpecObject)
      A user specified object.

    • Method Detail

      • channelReadLocking

        void channelReadLocking(boolean locking)
        If true, the connection will use lock on reading.
        Parameters:
        locking - the readLocking to set

        Returns:

      • nakMount

        void nakMount(boolean nakMount)
        If true, indicates that the server wants to reject the incoming connection. This may be due to some kind of connection limit being reached. For non-blocking connections to successfully complete rejection, the initialization process must still be completed.
        Parameters:
        nakMount - the nakMount to set

      • nakMount

        boolean nakMount()
        If true, indicates that the server wants to reject the incoming connection. This may be due to some kind of connection limit being reached. For non-blocking connections to successfully complete rejection, the initialization process must still be completed.
        Returns:
        the nakMount

      • userSpecObject

        void userSpecObject(java.lang.Object userSpecObject)
        A user specified object. This value is not modified by the transport, but will be preserved and stored in the userSpecObject of the Channel returned from Server.accept(AcceptOptions, Error). If this value is not set, the Channel.userSpecObject() will be set to the userSpecObject associated with the Server that is accepting this connection.
        Parameters:
        userSpecObject - the userSpecObject to set

      • userSpecObject

        java.lang.Object userSpecObject()
        A user specified object. This value is not modified by the transport, but will be preserved and stored in the userSpecObject of the Channel returned from Server.accept(AcceptOptions, Error). If this value is not set, the Channel.userSpecObject() will be set to the userSpecObject associated with the Server that is accepting this connection.
        Returns:
        the userSpecObject

      • sysSendBufSize

        void sysSendBufSize(int sysSendBufSize)
        The size (in kilobytes) of the system's send buffer used for this connection, where applicable. Setting of 0 indicates to use default sizes. This can also be set or changed via Channel.ioctl(int, int, Error). Must be in the range of 0 - 2,147,483,647.
        Parameters:
        sysSendBufSize - the sysSendBufSize to set

      • sysSendBufSize

        int sysSendBufSize()
        The size (in kilobytes) of the system's send buffer used for this connection, where applicable. Setting of 0 indicates to use default sizes. This can also be set or changed via Channel.ioctl(int, int, Error).
        Returns:
        the sysSendBufSize

      • clear

        void clear()
        Clears UPA Accept Options.
